Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: jen1933
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here if you like clean bathrooms, without bugs, hot waer, ripped beds and unhelpful staff. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “value”
Reviews.Author: tsukasa
Reviews.Content: good location. value price. fan in the bath room was broken and made a big noise. wireless internet need $6, and PC in the lobby was busy

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE! The Grant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d0ra_the_expl0ra
Reviews.Content: Where do i start with my endless list of faults with the Grant Hotel. After finally arriving at the Grant Hotel, or should I say, the Alexandar as it is named above the door, our nightmare begun! First thoughts were, small, quiet and strange smell. We made our way to the tiny lift which looked ready to collapse to get to our 2nd floor appartment. Our room, well our box, was awful! the bed was rock hard and linnen was itchy. As we opened the blinds, we were face to face with a brick wall. On further inspection we found bare wires from plug sockets and light fittings. the bathroom was in the room next door to us and was shared with the rest of the people on our floor whom seemed to be permanent residents at the dive. There were more bare wires to be found next to the mirror, above the sink. We were disturbed each night with the noisy heating system, We were told it would only last a few minutes, however 20 minutes later it was still going. When we originally booked our holiday we planned to stay 3nights, however we later extended it to 4, On returning to the hotel on the 4th night, we were surprised to find our room had been completely emptied. Our stuff had all been thrown into black bags and put into a cupboard downstairs. Cleaners had not been informed we were staying an extra night so had removed our belongings. Thankfully the wonderful city 'New York' made up for the appalling conditions we slept in. We will definately be returning to New York, however we will not be visiting The Grant Hotel, and advise anyone, even those with a low budget to stay well clear!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jastelem
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 5th visit to NYC on 1st December, having stayed at the Grant for the first time as the hotel we normally stay in was full. Our otherwise enjoyable visit was marred by our terrible experience in this hotel. Upon arrival we were informed that the hotel would require photocopies of our photo ID and credit card details (the former we were aware of but the latter we were not told about in the confirmation email we had received in advance). We were reluctant to provide these as they were stored (along with everyone else's details) in a plastic box on the front desk where, potentially, anyone could just lean across and take them. The receptionist stated that he had no secure location (safe, office, drawer) in which to store the paperwork and we were told to leave if we didn't like it! The 'security manager' then appeared and involved himself in the argument which culminated in him telling us that he didn't like us and we should go and sleep on the streets. We asked to see the manager and were told that he wasn't in and no-one knew when he was due back on duty. Given that it was Thanksgiving Day, we had little choice but to stay at the hotel as we had nowhere else to go. The room itself was too warm with no way of controlling the heat, the air-con was too noisy to have on for too long and there were exposed wires all over the place, including the hallways and bathrooms. Both my friend and I developed curious rashes after a few days of staying at the hotel..I would not like to hazard a guess as to the cause! The final horror was when we had two brand new pairs of childrens' trainers (still in their boxes) stolen from our locked hotel room the day before we left and the response from the receptionist was 'call 911.' Again we asked for the manager; again we were told that he wasn't in and no-one knew when he would be back on duty. I love NYC and am determined that this experience will not put me off but, rest assured, that any future stays will certainly not involve the Grant Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: MarkInSF
Reviews.Content: I was afraid to stay here because of the mixed reviews, but the throwaway price ($190 with tax for 3 nights) convinced me to give it a try. My fear was misplaced. The Grant (also known as The Devon) is one of the best travel bargains I have ever gotten. The room was clean and reasonably appointed (about the quality of an older "motel"). I hate hotel room odors of any sort, and my room ranked way better than average, with only a very slight 'small room' smell that blew off as soon as I cracked the window. The shared bath was modern (more than the room), fully tiled, and well cleaned at least twice daily (again with no smell). The guests seem to consist of mostly young bargain travellers. Book on the Woogo website for the best price. Also search for a coupon (I found one pretty easily). Though the booking process was not flawless, it was resolved by staff pleasantly and efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug warning”
Reviews.Author: MattFromLondon32131
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly offers value for money, and is in a good location only 1.5 blocks from the subway. There are also some nice restaurants a short walk up broadway (especially recommended is Regional, just a short walk up broadway for a lovely Italian) The bathrooms were also cleaned regularly and rarely had to wait at all. Unfourtunately this was all let down by the bed bugs. Having read through the reviews on this site it seems several people have experienced this as well and quite a few havent so seems to me this is not a hotel wide issue. We were in room 319 initially and when I complained to the reception they were more than happy to move us and didn't seem phased at all, so it seemed to me something they were rather used to. We were moved to room 510, and I think the bugs were in there too as i ended up with an arm and upper body covered in bites which become quite inflamed and required me to visit a doctor after leaving New York for treatment. My advice overall would be to avoid this hotel just incase, and if you are offered room 319 or 510 make sure you change straight away - the staff didn't seem like they were going to do anything about getting rid of them in our first room!

Reviews.Title: “worth the price especially if you book through expedia”
Reviews.Author: JennyJen2009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night and it was great. I booked it through expedia so it was a lot cheaper than calling the hotel directly or using hotels.com. ($50 cheaper!). The only downfall is the shared bathrooms. I never had to wait and they were fairly clean, but I would have preferred my own bathroom if I could've afforded it. It was really close to the subway, restaurants, and riverside park. It was also very quiet! You would never think you were in NYC once you actually got inside the hotel. It's perfect if you're busy all day in the city and just want a quiet, warm place to sleep at night. They also had a tv with cable, but we only used it to check the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: mskelly83
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC for the weekend to see the Dane Cook show. I went with my two friends and my boyfriend. We got two double beds in one room for $148/night. I tried to lower their expectations, I had read mixed reviews on this website. I told them we would have to share a bathroom in the hallway and they all thought we were staying in a hostel. Anyway, we arrived...the front lobby kind of smells "old" but not gross or anything, just old. It was an old building and reminded me of my grandma's apartment in Chicago. The elevator is pretty small but really, that is one of the only complaints I have! The room was clean, the AC worked great, the tv had a bunch of channels but really, we only wanted a place to sleep, we spent most of our time out shopping or on the town. We brought extra sheets, but I didn't use mine. I did bring a towel though, make sure you do that, the towels they provide are very small. Overall, everyone praised my decision, said I did such a good job finding a cheap hotel that was clean, and comfortable. I would absolutely stay there again. And no, I don't work for the hotel (my friends all said the good reviews on this website probably came from the people that work there) but I disagree since the staff doesn't really speak English that well. If you want an affordable place to stay choose here. It's about a 10 minute cab ride from Times Square or about 15 min on the subway, which is right up the street. Definitely reccommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs ruin an otherwise good place”
Reviews.Author: dave999909084
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nite--woke up to bug bites--not the worse i've experienced, but still not good. otherwise, place was pretty nice. Can't go back b/c bedbugs will bite!

Reviews.Title: “Top budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gymqueen52
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights stay at the Grant Hotel New York.. The rooms were a good size ( 2 double beds), lots of tv stations (we even got to watch lost series 3!) and a big cupboard to put all our cases and shopping in!! Compared to other places we have stayed in New York it was brill (West side Inn aka crappy side Inn) When we arrived we found the bathrooms to be very clean and water always hot. the only times the bath rooms were left in a mess was when the other people left it without cleaning up after themselves usually at peak times morning and night (ignore previous bad reviews stating cockroaches etc as we found it to be absolutely fine Not far from the station at all 2 blocks (2 mins), and the dinner on broadway near the hotel is fab for breakfasts. would recommend getting a metro rail card to get round the city and $21 7 day unlimited its a bargin we took the advice of others and took a cheap pillow each from the pound shop and they came in very handy, hotel supplies towels but we took cheap ones and left them there too. looks like the hotel has been recently renovated looking at the top floor which is being done at the moment. be prepared for a bit of a wait for the bathrooms in the morning but thats to be expected (there are 3 on each floor) all in all a good hotel and we would definately return in the future

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sannador
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not exactly a hotel - it's more of a b&b without the breakfast or a campground without the tents or a hostel without sufficient facilities. There isn't so much as a lobby, just a counter in the hallway. There are only two one-person-bathrooms per floor which means you might not have the opportunity to use a bathroom for a long time, and when you got the opportunity make sure you bring your own toilet paper and your flip flops as the floor might be flooded. At night it can't be calm as the a/c was fitted in the window in an improvised way. No view, a lot of noises. All in all too much too bear to pay $160 per night (October 23, 2006). One-star-rating for not meeting roaches or bedbugs! (Half-star-rating wasn't possible)

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, surprise”
Reviews.Author: Frankie9
Reviews.Content: "When you spend as little as 75 bucks for a night in Manhattan, you get a bit scared and expect the least. But none of it comes true: The Grant Hotel is a positive surprise. The room was very clean and spacious. TV and A/C - now what else do you need? Okay, here's the disadvantage: You have to share the bathroom (which is very clean as well). Now that shouldn't be a problem as long as you are not on a romantic honeymoon trip or stay longer than two or three nights. Staff was very friendly. And if you want to get away from lovely Upper west Side: The subway is just two blocks away."

Reviews.Title: “Great Find for a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfo-dub-commuter
Reviews.Content: Excellent find in a great safe neighborhood close to subway. The room I had was a double for my single rate and it was very clean a few amenities, nice towels etc. The bathrooms are shared but they are one person only b& sh in one. I would stay here again. I did find a $71 rate on line which was a rare find.It's higher most of the time.Desk staff also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap option”
Reviews.Author: skuls
Reviews.Content: I needed one night and it had to be cheap. I didn´t want to go to a hostel and sleep with some bugs. So I checked on Expedia and I got a great rate on this hotel and was very plesently supriced to find it clean. We had some problem checking in but worked out at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitripper99
Reviews.Content: Woogo Devon/Grant Hotel - 306 W 94th I was pretty good for a budget hotel.. you do get what you pay for. There have been some pretty bad reviews for this place but I don't think they're justified. Maybe there was a change in management? The staff are friendly and helpful, the room was really clean and the bathrooms as well most of the time. We had two shared (but fully private) bathrooms on our floor and during the week we stayed there only had to wait once for a free one I think. We arrived at 7am and they were happy to store our luggage until checkin time (2pm) free of charge. Pretty handy location - 1,2 and 3 trains stop on Broadway which is less than 30sec walk away. Lots of dining options closeby if you need. They've got one comp with internet access down by the lobby $10c a minute I think, and if you've got a laptop + network cable you can get net access directly in you room for $10 midday to midday. Negatives - they don't take cash, so if you want to pay for the net, book an extra night or whatever, it's all gotta go on a credit card. Also, when we left the card on the door handle to have the room made up, twice we came back to our room later in the day to find it unlocked. And lastly - can be a bit noisy (other guests' doors - you'll see what I mean!), so take earplugs if you wanna get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price - great location”
Reviews.Author: JATanaka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an excellent location on 94th Street, between West End Avenue and Riverside Drive (and the park). It's less than 2 blocks from Broadway and is convenient to the subway station at 96th and Broadway. Plenty of restaurants and fast food places on Broadway and there's a 24 hour Gristede's (supermarket) on 95th. You can get excellent tacos from a late night taco truck, which parks on 95th (between Broadway and West End Avenue) in front of Gristede's. I had made reservation online, the night before arrival. They had received it and there was no problem with check-in. Room was quite plain and although there is a window, it was dark as it didn't face the street. On sunnier days, I imagine it can be brighter if you let in daylight by opening the blinds a bit. But it had a double bed and a small window AC so room was larger than I expected, with a desk and chair. The closet space had no racks, poles or hangers. The bedside lamp would've brightened up the room, however, it wasn't working. TV has basic cable channels but I think someone had made off with the remote control or it was misplaced somewhere. I couldn't find it. The shared bathroom was clean. If the one closest to the room was occupied, there was another across the hallway that was open. I saw workmen in the building so they must be remodeling or decorating rooms. I've stayed at similar hotels in NYC in the past and was surprised to find that housekeeping hadn't supplied new towels or make the bed the second day but I decided it wasn't a big deal since I was only there for 2 nights. I would consider staying there again if I could book at the super-low rate I got for Oct. 3rd and Oct. 4th, 2006.

HotelInfo.Name: The Grant Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 306 W 94th St, New York City, NY 10025
